a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 6"
and h1 : "k = 3"
and h2 : "fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k)) = binomial n k"
shows  "binomial n k = 20"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute $\dbinom{6}{3}$. The final Answer is 20
 ### Proof
 \begin{align} \dbinom{6}{3} &= \dfrac{6!}{3!3!} \\ &= \dfrac{6\times 5\times 4}{3\times 2\times 1} \\ &= \dfrac{6}{3\times 2\times 1} \times 5 \times 4 \\ &= 1 \times 5 \times 4 \\ &= \boxed{20}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes n k :: nat
assumes h0 : "n = 6"
and h1 : "k = 3"
and h2 : "fact n div (fact k * fact (n - k)) = binomial n k"
shows  "binomial n k = 20"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the value of the binomial coefficient $\binom{n}{k}$ when $n = 6$ and $k = 3$. The final answer is 20.
